intro: Lomanthus cantensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian fanflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive, fan-like appearance. Lomanthus cantensis is typically found growing in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
